channel.title: [PI] dfs charge doesnt save
channel.description:
heres the code it doesnt save [code] characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("dfsCharge = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.dfsCharge), 0, Integer.toString(p.dfsCharge).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.newLine();[/code] if i put 13 it spams the run cmd with this right after i logout
[code][6/11/11 12:46 PM]: Initializing start up... [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: Loading scripts... .\Data\scripts\player\eat\eat.pyscript: .\Data\scripts\player\items\spade.pypt: .\Data\scripts\player\npc\npc1.pycript: .\Data\scripts\player\npc\npc2.pycript: .\Data\scripts\player\npc\npc3.pycript: .\Data\scripts\player\objects\objectclick1.py .\Data\scripts\player\objects\objectclick2.py .\Data\scripts\player\objects\objectclick3.py .\Data\scripts\player\skills\herblore.py .\Data\scripts\player\skills\mining.py: .\Data\scripts\player\skills\prayer.py: .\Data\scripts\player\skills\woodcutting.py [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: Loaded 12 scripts! [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: Rune Of Gods successfully started, current server port:43594
[6/11/11 12:46 PM]: [REGISTERED]: Imsuperman05 [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 13 [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: at java.lang.String.getChars(String.java:849) [6/11/11 12:46 PM]: at java.io.BufferedWriter.write(BufferedWriter.java:208)

item.title: [PI] dfs charge doesnt save
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

case 53:
			case 54:
			case 55:
			int dragFire = Misc.random(1);
			if (dragFire == 0) {
				npcs[i].attackType = 0;
				npcs[i].projectileId = -1;
				npcs[i].endGfx = -1;
			} else {
				npcs[i].attackType = 3;
				npcs[i].projectileId = 393;
				npcs[i].endGfx = 430;
			}
			break;

add that in the loadSpell method in the NPCHandler class

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] dfs charge doesnt save
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

oh nvm then but how can i test it if the green dragons dont use dragon fire… how do i add it?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] dfs charge doesnt save
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

that number represents how many pieces of string that line contains , dfsCharge_=_ has 12 characters , therefore you have to put 12 ( but it seems you’ve already done that )

Why would you want to put 13 ?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] dfs charge doesnt save
